intro: Hemizonia minima, commonly known as the small hemizonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has finely divided leaves and produces small, white or greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Hemizonia minima is often found in association with other members of the Apiaceae family in its native range.
